intro: Avenaria, commonly known as sand mat, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. These plants are typically small, mat-forming herbs that thrive in sandy or rocky soils. They are characterized by their delicate, often hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that can range in color from white to pink. Avenaria species are often found in arid or coastal environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Their botanical features make them important components of ecological systems in their native habitats.
